body:
### Problem

I've got a pretty fluid setup, trying various things and so any debugging utilities is handy.
Running `:checkhealth vim.treesitter` I end up with 

```
- OK Parser: c                    ABI: 14, path: /home/teto/parsers/parser/c.so
- OK Parser: graphql              ABI: 13, path: /home/teto/parsers/parser/graphql.so
- OK Parser: http                 ABI: 14, path: /home/teto/parsers/parser/http.so
- OK Parser: json                 ABI: 14, path: /home/teto/parsers/parser/json.so
- OK Parser: lua                  ABI: 14, path: /home/teto/parsers/parser/lua.so
- OK Parser: norg                 ABI: 14, path: /home/teto/parsers/parser/norg.so
- OK Parser: org                  ABI: 14, path: /home/teto/parsers/parser/org.so
- OK Parser: query                ABI: 14, path: /home/teto/parsers/parser/query.so
- OK Parser: xml                  ABI: 14, path: /home/teto/parsers/parser/xml.so
- OK Parser: hurl                 ABI: 14, path: /nix/store/0dbjwf3zrpjc4b3a0rjxk0bwvaakg7b0-vim-pack-dir/pack/myNeovimPackages/start/vimplugin-treesitter-grammar-hurl/parser/hurl.so
- OK Parser: json                 ABI: 14, path: /nix/store/0dbjwf3zrpjc4b3a0rjxk0bwvaakg7b0-vim-pack-dir/pack/myNeovimPackages/start/vimplugin-treesitter-grammar-json/parser/json.so
- OK Parser: nix                  ABI: 13, path: /nix/store/0dbjwf3zrpjc4b3a0rjxk0bwvaakg7b0-vim-pack-dir/pack/myNeovimPackages/start/vimplugin-treesitter-grammar-nix/parser/nix.so
- OK Parser: query                ABI: 14, path: /nix/store/0dbjwf3zrpjc4b3a0rjxk0bwvaakg7b0-vim-pack-dir/pack/myNeovimPackages/start/vimplugin-treesitter-grammar-query/parser/query.so
- OK Parser: hurl                 ABI: 14, path: /home/teto/.local/share/nvim/site/pack/hm/start/vimplugin-treesitter-grammar-hurl/parser/hurl.so
- OK Parser: json                 ABI: 14, path: /home/teto/.local/share/nvim/site/pack/hm/start/vimplugin-treesitter-grammar-json/parser/json.so
- OK Parser: nix                  ABI: 13, path: /home/teto/.local/share/nvim/site/pack/hm/start/vimplugin-treesitter-grammar-nix/parser/nix.so
- OK Parser: query                ABI: 14, path: /home/teto/.local/share/nvim/site/pack/hm/start/vimplugin-treesitter-grammar-query/parser/query.so
- OK Parser: haskell              ABI: 14, path: /home/teto/.local/share/nvim/site/pack/luarocks/opt/tree-sitter-haskell/parser/haskell.so
```

You will notice the messy redundant parsers. 

### Expected behavior

While the redundant parsers are not an error, I wonder if we could emphasize the redundant ones as the user might not be aware of them.
`:h treesitter-parsers` mentions
```
Parsers are searched for as `parser/{lang}.*` in any 'runtimepath' directory.
If multiple parsers for the same language are found, the first one is used.
```
so maybe we should display the parsers by name with an arrow flagging the used one:
```
- OK Parser: json         ABI: 14, path: /home/teto/parsers/parser/json.so <--- loaded
                                    ABI: 14, path: /nix/store/0dbjwf3zrpjc4b3a0rjxk0bwvaakg7b0-vim-pack-dir/pack/myNeovimPackages/start/vimplugin-treesitter-grammar-json/parser/json.so
                                    ABI: 14, path: /home/teto/.local/share/nvim/site/pack/hm/start/vimplugin-treesitter-grammar-json/parser/json.so
```
or keep the current output with some warning. If there is an id for each grammar (or could just generate one 
```
- OK Parser 1: json                 ABI: 14, path: /home/teto/parsers/parser/json.so
- OK Parser 2: lua                  ABI: 14, path: /home/teto/parsers/parser/lua.so
- OK Parser 3: norg                 ABI: 14, path: /home/teto/parsers/parser/norg.so
- OK Parser 4: json                 ABI: 14, path: /nix/store/0dbjwf3zrpjc4b3a0rjxk0bwvaakg7b0-vim-pack-dir/pack/myNeovimPackages/start/vimplugin-treesitter-grammar-json/parser/json.so (might be shadowed by parser id 1)
```
title: emphasize redundant parsers in checkhealth output
